moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 b6 4. Nc3 Bb7: usually in this variation 7.e3 is played.
moves.7... c5: usually played here 7...Be7 with the idea of 0-0.
moves.8. e4 Nxc3 9. bxc3 Nc6 10. Bb2 Rc8 11. R: not 12...Nxd4?.13.Qa4+ and black loses a piece . and if 12...Nb4.13.Bb5+-Nc6.14.d5 and black loses apiece .
moves.13. Qd2 Na5 14. d5 exd5 15. exd5 Bd6: in this position white have big advantange , and the strange thing is that the intrnationl master Morey cant do  nothing about it , even moves like 15...Nc4.16.Bxc4-Rxc4.17.0-0.... or 15...Qe7+.16.Be2-Nc4.17.d6! now white getting material advantage .
moves.16. Bxg7 Qe7+ 17. Be2 Rg8 18. Qh6 f5: there is no choise for black, if 18...Rc2.19.Nd4! with Qxh7.
moves.24... Re8 25. Bh6+ Kg8 26. Qg4+: and black resigned . how great kasparov relay is , making this game look so easy vs the Israel international master Jacob Morey . thank you and i hope you enjoy this game .
